sailpoint.api
Class SailPointFactory

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.api.SailPointFactory

public class SailPointFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Factory service for SailPointContexts.

The SailPointContext is the primary API that most of the system code should use to access core services like the persistent store, the task scheduler, and the email notifier. A SailPointContext must be obtained by calling this factory which knows how to create them from a prototype instances injected by Spring.

Once created, contexts are placed in thread local storage so they can be accessed from any level of the code, though the convention we usually follow is to pass a context to the constructor of a business logic class which then uses it internally, and passes it along to any classes it might create.

Method Detail

createContext

public static SailPointContext createContext()
                                      throws GeneralException
Create a new context and install it in thread local storage. Throws an exception if a context has already been installed. This is intended to be called by the topmost "request handlers" on the call stack for use by all the calls within the request. In current practice this will happen in the following situations: 
   - SailPointContextRequestFilter, called around every HTTP request.
   - SailPointService, called around SOAP requests
   - JobAdapter, called around Quartz task threads
   - RequestProcessor, called around request threads
   - unit tests
Code that calls this MUST also call SailPointFactory.releaseContext(SailPointContext) in a finally block to ensure the context is released.

Throws:
GeneralException

pushContext

public static SailPointContext pushContext()
                                    throws GeneralException
Temporarily switch to a new context while preserving the old one.

The current thread local SailPointContext is returned, it is assumed you will restore this later with restoreContext()

Throws:
GeneralException

popContext

public static void popContext(SailPointContext prev)
                       throws GeneralException
Restore a context previously replaced with SailPointFactory.pushContext().

Throws:
GeneralException

                           throws GeneralException
Restore a previous context returned by pushContext.

                                      throws GeneralException
Create a new context setting the user name.

GeneralException

createPrivateContext

public static SailPointContext createPrivateContext()
                                             throws GeneralException
Called in extremely rare situations where we need to create a context/transaction that is different than the one stored in the thread local. Currently this happens only in the identity pages to commit a snapshot without committing the Identity changes.

Throws:
GeneralException

releasePrivateContext

public static void releasePrivateContext(SailPointContext context)
                                  throws GeneralException
Release a context previously created with SailPointFactory.createPrivateContext().

Throws:
GeneralException

getCurrentContext

public static SailPointContext getCurrentContext()
                                          throws GeneralException
Return the current context. This is the method most often called by system and custom code. Unless you are creating your own threads, it is likely that a context has already been registered for the current thread.

Throws:
GeneralException

peekCurrentContext

public static SailPointContext peekCurrentContext()
Return the current context if one exists. Used for debugging where we do not want to throw.

releaseContext

public static void releaseContext(SailPointContext context,
                                  boolean publishMeters)
                           throws GeneralException
Release the given SailPointContext. This frees up any resources used by the context and causes getCurrentContext() method to return a newly initialized (or possibly the same - depending on the implementation of SailPointContext.getContext()) context.

You should always call this after calling SailPointFactory.createContext() otherwise the context can leak. Try/finally blocks are recommended.

Throws:
GeneralException

releaseContext

public static void releaseContext(SailPointContext context)
                           throws GeneralException
Release the given context.

Throws:
GeneralException
See Also:
SailPointFactory.releaseContext(SailPointContext, boolean)

releaseContextNoMeters

public static void releaseContextNoMeters(SailPointContext context)
                                   throws GeneralException
An obscure option that prevents the automatic publication of the thread-local meters to the global meters. This is used in a few tasks that manage their own worker threads and want more control over how the meters are managed.

Throws:
GeneralException

setContext

public static void setContext(SailPointContext ctxt)
Allows a given thread to set the ThreadLocal context instance. This should be used in rare circumstances when a single context instance needs to be shared by a number of threads.

Currently this is being used for JasperReports, which spawns a large number of threads to execute sub-reports in parallel. Since we cannot afford to create a new context for each sub-report thread, the parent thread's context instance is shared by all sub-reports threads.

Parameters:
ctxt - SailPointContext instance to store in the thread local.

dumpUnreleased

public static void dumpUnreleased()
Send any information about unreleased contexts to stdout.
